title: Research
text:
I am currently researching affective polarization, civic duty, and voter turnout. The literature is inconclusive regarding a (clear) relationship between affective polarization and turnout. I theorize that civic duty may help explain the relationship by acting as a mediator.
My research interests include:

Affective polarization, also ideological and geographic polarization
Public opinion
Political behavior
State comparative politics
California politics




Climate Policies by State

title: Jillian Reynolds
text:
I am currently a second-year research master student in the Modern History and International Relations program at University of Groningen, Netherlands. A research master is a two-year, research-focused program for students interested in pursuing a PhD or career in a research field.

After completing the IB Diploma Programme and graduating high school, I attended UC San Diego in La Jolla, California. At UCSD, I majored in Political Science/International Relations and earned minors in History and Global Health.
After earning my BA in 2023, I spent a year working as a paraeducator for a local public school district while completing the four-course R for Data Analytics certificate program through UC San Diego Division of Extended Studies.
